qa.question: What do you mainly use your phone for?
qa.answer: I use my phone mainly for delivery work. I use delivery apps to accept orders, check addresses, call customers, and confirm deliveries. I also use Google Maps for navigation. Apart from work, I use WhatsApp, YouTube, and sometimes Facebook.

qa.question: Do you share your phone with others?
qa.answer: No, I usually don’t share my phone because delivery apps and payment apps are logged in. Sometimes I give it to my wife to make a call, but not for long.

qa.question: What apps and features do you frequently use?
qa.answer: I mostly use delivery apps, Google Maps, phone calls, WhatsApp, UPI apps, and the camera to upload delivery proof photos. I also use YouTube for time pass.

qa.question: Do you read app permissions before allowing them?
qa.answer: Sometimes I read, but not fully. If the app is needed for work, I allow permissions like location and camera. Otherwise, I don’t think much.

qa.question: How do you decide whether an app is safe to use?
qa.answer: If the company I work for asks me to use it, I trust it. I also trust apps that many other delivery boys use. I don’t install random apps.

qa.question: Have you ever deleted messages, photos, or apps for privacy?
qa.answer: Yes, I delete delivery photos after some days. I also delete WhatsApp chats and videos when storage gets full.

qa.question: What do you do before giving your phone for repair?
qa.answer: I log out of delivery apps and UPI apps. I remove the SIM card. I don’t know how to delete everything properly, so I feel worried.

qa.question: Have you asked someone for help with phone problems?
qa.answer: Yes, I ask other delivery boys or go to a mobile shop. Sometimes I watch YouTube videos to fix issues.

qa.question: Who do you trust most when sharing personal or sensitive information?
qa.answer: I trust my wife and sometimes my supervisor. I don’t share personal details with customers.

qa.question: Have you used code words or nicknames to keep something private?
qa.answer: Yes, I save customer numbers with short names or order numbers so others don’t understand.

qa.question: Have you ever helped someone install or use an app?
qa.answer: Yes, I helped a new delivery boy install delivery and navigation apps. I showed him basic use but not about permissions.

qa.question: Do you know how to stop an app from using your camera, microphone, or location?
qa.answer: I know location can be turned off, but I don’t know much about camera or microphone settings.

qa.question: What do you do when you get warning messages on your phone?
qa.answer: I get confused and sometimes scared. I usually ignore them or ask another delivery boy what to do.

qa.question: What do you think happens when you give an app access to your contacts or photos?
qa.answer: I think the app can see those things. I don’t know if they save them somewhere else.

qa.question: Have you ever hesitated to take your phone for repair because of private content?
qa.answer: Yes, because payment apps and personal photos are there. I feel uncomfortable.

qa.question: Has a repair person ever opened your photos or apps without asking?
qa.answer: Once, a repair person opened my phone to check storage. I didn’t like it but didn’t stop him.

qa.question: Do you use a lock screen on your phone?
qa.answer: Yes, I use fingerprint and PIN. Without lock, anyone can misuse payment apps.

qa.question: Do you think local apps are safer than international ones?
qa.answer: I don’t know much about that. I use apps that my company or friends recommend.

qa.question: Who do you turn to when you don’t understand phone settings?
qa.answer: I ask my friends or other delivery boys. Sometimes I search on YouTube.

qa.question: Do people around you influence how you think about online safety?
qa.answer: Yes, other delivery boys warn me about fake calls, OTP frauds, and scams. I am careful because of that.

scenarios.Broken Phone: Before giving my phone for repair, I log out of delivery and payment apps and remove the SIM card. If I can’t do that, I delay the repair.
scenarios.Sharing with Family: If my wife uses my phone, I close delivery apps first.
scenarios.Installing a New App: I install only work-related apps or apps suggested by friends. I don’t click links from messages.
scenarios.Helping Elderly Relative: I help them make calls or use WhatsApp. I don’t explain app permissions much.
scenarios.Using Someone Else’s Phone: I only use it for calls or maps and return it quickly.
scenarios.Giving Away Phone: I ask a mobile shop person to delete everything before giving it away.
scenarios.Cloud Backup Surprise: I don’t know much about cloud backup. If old photos come back, I will delete them.
scenarios.Free Public WiFi: I sometimes use free WiFi but avoid opening payment or delivery apps.
scenarios.Lottery Call: I cut the call and block the number.
scenarios.Emergency Bank Transfer: I confirm by calling the person directly or asking my wife before sending money.
